sen.j: 土師馬手（はじ の うまて、生年不詳 - 和銅4年（711年）2月26日）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: HAJI no Umate (year of birth unknown, February 26, 711) was a person of the Asuka Period in Japan.
HAJI no Umate (year of birth unknown, February 26, 711) was a person of the Asuka Period in Japan.
HAJI no Umate (year of birth unknown, February 26, 711) was a person of the Asuka Period in Japan.

sen.j: 名は「はじのまて」とも読む。
sen.e: His name also can be read as 'HAJI no Mate.'
His name also can be read as 'HAJI no Mate.'
His name also can be read as 'HAJI no Mate.'

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: The reading of his name is the same in the old Japanese syallabary characters.
The reading of his name is the same in the old Japanese syallabary characters.
The reading of his name is the same in the old Japanese syallabary characters.

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は連、後に宿禰。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji, later to become Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).
His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji, later to become Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).
His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji, later to become Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）につき、信濃国など東山道の兵を興す使者になった。
sen.e: He sided with Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) during the Jinshin War of 672, and became an envoy that raised an army that belonged to the Tosando Road region of the Shinano Province.
He sided with Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) during the Jinshin War of 672, and became an envoy that raised an army that belonged to the Tosando Road region of the Shinano Province.
He sided with Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) during the Jinshin War of 672, and became an envoy that raised an army that belonged to the Tosando Road region of the Shinano Province.

sen.j: 持統天皇と文武天皇の葬儀に働いた。
sen.e: He played a role in orchestrating the funeral ceremonies for Emperor Jito and Emperor Tenmu.
He played a role in orchestrating the funeral ceremonies for Emperor Jito and Emperor Tenmu.
He played a role in orchestrating the funeral ceremonies for Emperor Jito and Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 従四位下。
sen.e: He was given the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was given the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was given the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 壬申の乱が勃発したとき、土師馬手は屯田司の舎人であった。
sen.e: HAJI no Umate was the toneri (palace servant) for the Minister of Imperial Domains when the Jinshin War broke out.
HAJI no Umate was the toneri (palace servant) for the Minister of Imperial Domains when the Jinshin War broke out.
HAJI no Umate was the toneri (palace servant) for the Minister of Imperial Domains when the Jinshin War broke out.

sen.j: どこの屯田かは不明だが、後述の莬田（大和国の宇陀郡）の近くであろう。
sen.e: It is not clear as to which Imperial Domain he belonged to, but it is assumed to be somewhere near the later-mentioned Uda (Uda County of Yamato Province).
It is not clear as to which Imperial Domain he belonged to, but it is assumed to be somewhere near the later-mentioned Uda (Uda County of Yamato Province).
It is not clear as to which Imperial Domain he belonged to, but it is assumed to be somewhere near the later-mentioned Uda (Uda County of Yamato Province).

sen.j: その屯田が大海人皇子のためのものであろうとする説と、そうとは限らないとする説とがある。
sen.e: There is a theory purporting that the Imperial Domain belonged to Prince Oama and one that did not.
There is a theory purporting that the Imperial Domain belonged to Prince Oama, and also a theory which mentions this is not all true.
sen.cmt: and one that did not では違う説がある、というニュアンスが出ていないのでは、と思いました。
sen.e: There is a theory purporting that the Imperial Domain belonged to Prince Oama, and also a theory which mentions this is not all true.

sen.j: 壬申の年（672年）の6月24日、近江の朝廷と戦うことを決めた大海人皇子は、吉野宮から東に急いで莬田の吾城に至った。
sen.e: On June 24th during the year of Mizunoe-Saru (one of the Oriental Zodiac signs), having decided to declare war on the Imperial Court of Omi, Prince Oama departed from the Yoshinomiya Imperial Palace and hurriedly headed east for his own palace of Uda.

On June 24th during the year of Mizunoe-Saru (one of the Oriental Zodiac signs), having decided to declare war on the Imperial Court of Omi, Prince Oama departed from the Yoshinomiya Imperial Palace and hurriedly headed east for his own palace of Uda.

On June 24th during the year of Mizunoe-Saru (one of the Oriental Zodiac signs), having decided to declare war on the Imperial Court of Omi, Prince Oama departed from the Yoshinomiya Imperial Palace and hurriedly headed east for his own palace of Uda.

sen.j: このとき、土師馬手が一行に食事を提供した。
sen.e: At this time, HAJI no Umate offered food to the accompanying party.
At this time, HAJI no Umate offered food to the accompanying party.
At this time, HAJI no Umate offered food to the accompanying party.

sen.j: 馬手はそのまま皇子に従って行をともにしたらしい。
sen.e: It is believed that Umate just joined the procession under the orders of the Emperor.
It is believed that Umate just joined the procession under the orders of the Emperor.
It is believed that Umate just joined the procession under the orders of the Emperor.

sen.j: 伊勢国の朝明郡で、皇子は土師馬手を稚桜部五百瀬とともに東山（東山道）に遣わして兵を興させた。
sen.e: At the Asake County in Ise Province, the Emperor dispatched HAJI no Umate with WAKASAKURABE no Iose to Mt. Higashiyama (Tosando Road) to raisean army.
At the Asake County in Ise Province, the Emperor dispatched HAJI no Umate with WAKASAKURABE no Iose to Mt. Higashiyama (Tosando Road) to raisean army.
At the Asake County in Ise Province, the Emperor dispatched HAJI no Umate with WAKASAKURABE no Iose to Mt. Higashiyama (Tosando Road) to raisean army.

sen.j: 以上は『日本書紀』の記述で、『釈日本紀』は『安斗智徳日記』の中に（皇子が）「信濃国の兵を発させた」という文があると指摘する。
sen.e: Thus far is what has been written in "The Nihonshoki," and it is pointed out by "The Shaku Nihongi" (an annotated text of the Nihonshoki) that there is a passage in "The Diary of ATO no Chitoko" saying that the Emperor "raised an army in the Shinano Province."

Thus far is what has been written in "The Nihonshoki," and it is pointed out by "The Shaku Nihongi" (an annotated text of the Nihonshoki) that there is a passage in "The Diary of ATO no Chitoko" saying that the Emperor "raised an army in the Shinano Province."

Thus far is what has been written in "The Nihonshoki," and it is pointed out by "The Shaku Nihongi" (an annotated text of the Nihonshoki) that there is a passage in "The Diary of ATO no Chitoko" saying that the Emperor "raised an army in the Shinano Province."

sen.j: 両書の違いは動員が上野国、下野国などまで及んだかに関わる。
sen.e: The differences in the two texts pertain to whether the army was mobilized as far as Kozuke Province and Shimotsuke Province and so on.
The differences in the two texts pertain to whether the army was mobilized as far as Kozuke Province and Shimotsuke Province and so on.
The differences in the two texts pertain to whether the army was mobilized as far as Kozuke Province and Shimotsuke Province and so on.

sen.j: 乱の後、書紀が天武天皇、持統天皇の代を記す中に馬手の名は現れない。
sen.e: After the War, Umate's name does not appear in the Nihonshoki records that covers the eras of Emperor Tenmu and Emperor Jito.
After the War, Umate's name does not appear in the Nihonshoki records that covers the eras of Emperor Tenmu and Emperor Jito.
After the War, Umate's name does not appear in the Nihonshoki records that covers the eras of Emperor Tenmu and Emperor Jito.

sen.j: 天武天皇13年（684年）2月2日に、土師連など50氏は宿禰姓を与えられた。
sen.e: On February 2nd, 684, HAJI no Muraji as well as 50 other clans were given the kabane of Sukune.
On February 2nd, 684, HAJI no Muraji as well as 50 other clans were given the kabane of Sukune.
On February 2nd, 684, HAJI no Muraji as well as 50 other clans were given the kabane of Sukune.

sen.j: 『続日本紀』では、文武天皇とその次の元明天皇の代に、天皇の陵と葬儀に関する記事で馬手が頻出する。
sen.e: In the "The Shoku Nihongi," during the era of Emperor Monmu and Emperor Genmei, Umate's name is frequently mentioned in the articles related to the Emperor's misasagi (an Imperial mausoleum) and funeral ceremony.

In the "The Shoku Nihongi," during the era of Emperor Monmu and Emperor Genmei, Umate's name is frequently mentioned in the articles related to the Emperor's misasagi (an Imperial mausoleum) and funeral ceremony.

In the "The Shoku Nihongi," during the era of Emperor Monmu and Emperor Genmei, Umate's name is frequently mentioned in the articles related to the Emperor's misasagi (an Imperial mausoleum) and funeral ceremony.

sen.j: 馬手はその中心というわけではなく、多数の官人の中の一人ということが多かった。
sen.e: Umate was not necessarily the central figure during the funeral, but rather, he was known as one of the figures among the many officials.
Umate was not necessarily the central figure during the funeral, but rather, he was known as one of the figures among the many officials.
Umate was not necessarily the central figure during the funeral, but rather, he was known as one of the figures among the many officials.

sen.j: まず、文武天皇元年（697年）1月19日に、新羅の使者金弼徳らが持ってきた貢物を献じるため大内山陵に遣わされた。
sen.e: First, on January 19th, 697, Umate was dispatched to Oyamauchi no Misasagi to offer the misagimono (tribute) brought over by Kinhitsutoku, the envoy from Shiragi (an ancient Korean kingdom).
First, on January 19th, 697, Umate was dispatched to Oyamauchi no Misasagi to offer the misagimono (tribute) brought over by Kinhitsutoku, the envoy from Shiragi (an ancient Korean kingdom).
First, on January 19th, 697, Umate was dispatched to Oyamauchi no Misasagi to offer the misagimono (tribute) brought over by Kinhitsutoku, the envoy from Shiragi (an ancient Korean kingdom).

sen.j: 文武天皇3年（700年）10月20日に、越智山陵と山科山陵を修造するために官人が二手に分かれて派遣されたとき、山科山陵に大石王、粟田真人、土師馬手、小治田当麻と判官3人、主典2人、大工2人が遣わされた。
sen.e: On October 20th, 700, when the two teams of government officials were dispatched to mend Ochi no Misasagi and Yamashina no Misasagi, OISHI no Okimi, AWATA no Mahito, HAJI no Umate, Oharida no Taima and three hangan (judges), two sakans (low level officials) and two carpenters were sent.

On October 20th, 700, when the two teams of government officials were dispatched to mend Ochi no Misasagi and Yamashina no Misasagi, OISHI no Okimi, AWATA no Mahito, HAJI no Umate, Oharida no Taima and three hangan (judges), two sakans (low level officials) and two carpenters were sent.

On October 20th, 700, when the two teams of government officials were dispatched to mend Ochi no Misasagi and Yamashina no Misasagi, OISHI no Okimi, AWATA no Mahito, HAJI no Umate, Oharida no Taima and three hangan (judges), two sakans (low level officials) and two carpenters were sent.

sen.j: 大宝2年（702年）12月22日に持統天皇が死ぬと、翌大宝3年（703年）10月9日に、御葬司が任命された。
sen.e: When Emperor Jito died on December 22nd, 702, a gososhi (an official who handled imperial funerals) was appointed on October 9th, 703.
When Emperor Jito died on December 22nd, 702, a gososhi (an official who handled imperial funerals) was appointed on October 9th, 703.
When Emperor Jito died on December 22nd, 702, a gososhi (an official who handled imperial funerals) was appointed on October 9th, 703.

sen.j: その正五位下土師宿祢馬手は、息長王、高橋笠間とともに、造御竈長官の志紀親王を補佐する副になった。
sen.e: Shogoinoge HAJI no Sukune Umate became the second person in charge who assisted The Director of Imperial Funeral Pyre, Prince Shiki along with OKINAGA no Okimi and TAKAHASHI no Kasama.

Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), HAJI no Sukune Umate became the second person in charge who assisted The Director of Imperial Funeral Pyre, Prince Shiki along with OKINAGA no Okimi and TAKAHASHI no Kasama.
sen.cmt: 正五位下の意味を入れた方がいいと思います。
sen.e: Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), HAJI no Sukune Umate became the second person in charge who assisted The Director of Imperial Funeral Pyre, Prince Shiki along with OKINAGA no Okimi and TAKAHASHI no Kasama.

sen.j: 葬儀はその年の12月に執り行われた。
sen.e: The funeral ceremony took place in December 703.
The funeral ceremony took place in December 703.
The funeral ceremony took place in December 703.

sen.j: 慶雲4年（707年）6月15日に文武天皇が死ぬと、10月3日に正五位上土師宿祢馬手が、下毛古麻呂（下毛野古麻呂）、民比良夫、石上豊庭、藤原房前とともに造山陵使に任じられた。
sen.e: When Emperor Monmu died on June 15th, 707, HAJI no Sukune Umate who was promoted to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) on October 3rd, was appointed as the Imperial envoy to Tusukuriyama no Misasagi along with SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro, TAMI no Hirao, and ISONOKAMI no Toyoniwa.

When Emperor Monmu died on June 15th, 707, HAJI no Sukune Umate who was promoted to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) on October 3rd, was appointed as the Imperial envoy to Tusukuriyama no Misasagi along with SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro, TAMI no Hirao, and ISONOKAMI no Toyoniwa.

When Emperor Monmu died on June 15th, 707, HAJI no Sukune Umate who was promoted to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) on October 3rd, was appointed as the Imperial envoy to Tusukuriyama no Misasagi along with SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro, TAMI no Hirao, and ISONOKAMI no Toyoniwa.

sen.j: この葬儀は11月に執り行われた。
sen.e: This funeral took place in November.
This funeral took place in November.
This funeral took place in November.

sen.j: 和銅2年（709年）1月9日に従四位下に進み、2年後の和銅4年（711年）2月26日に、従四位下土師宿祢馬手は死んだ。
sen.e: He was promoted to Jushinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) on January 9th, 709, and Jushinoge HAJI no Sukukne Umate died two years later on February 26th, 711.
He was promoted to Jushinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) on January 9th, 709, and Jushinoge HAJI no Sukukne Umate died two years later on February 26th, 711.
He was promoted to Jushinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) on January 9th, 709, and Jushinoge HAJI no Sukukne Umate died two years later on February 26th, 711.

sen.j: 天武天皇元年（672年）6月24日 - 大海人皇子（天武天皇）に従って吉野宮を発った。
sen.e: On June 24th, 672, Umate departed from the Yoshinomiya Imperial House under the orders of Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).
On June 24th, 672, Umate departed from the Yoshinomiya Imperial House under the orders of Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).
On June 24th, 672, Umate departed from the Yoshinomiya Imperial House under the orders of Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).

sen.j: 同年6月26日 - 兵を興すため東山に赴いた。
sen.e: June 26th, 672: Umate Went to Mt. Higashiyama to raise an army.
June 26th, 672: Umate Went to Mt. Higashiyama to raise an army.
June 26th, 672: Umate Went to Mt. Higashiyama to raise an army.

sen.j: 天武天皇13年（684年）12月2日 - 連姓になった。
sen.e: December 2nd, 684: Umate was given the kabane of Muraji.
December 2nd, 684: Umate was given the kabane of Muraji.
December 2nd, 684: Umate was given the kabane of Muraji.

sen.j: 文武天皇元年（697年）1月19日 - 新羅の貢を大内山陵に献じるため遣わされた。
sen.e: January 19th, 697: Umate was dispatched to Oyamauchi no Misasagi to offer the mitsugimono from Shiragi.
January 19th, 697: Umate was dispatched to Oyamauchi no Misasagi to offer the mitsugimono from Shiragi.
January 19th, 697: Umate was dispatched to Oyamauchi no Misasagi to offer the mitsugimono from Shiragi.

sen.j: 位は直広参。
sen.e: Umate was given the rank of Jikikosan (equivalent to Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
Umate was given the rank of Jikikosan (equivalent to Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
Umate was given the rank of Jikikosan (equivalent to Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 文武天皇3年（700年）10月20日 - 山科山陵の修造に遣わされた。
sen.e: October 20th, 700: Umate was dispatched to mend Yamashina no Misasagi.

sen.j: 位は直広参。
sen.e: He was ranked as Jikikosan.

sen.j: 大宝2年（702年）12月22日 - 持統天皇のための造御竈長官の副になった。
sen.e: December 22nd, 702: Umate became the second person in charge under the Director of Imperial Funeral Pyre for Emperor Jito.
December 22nd, 702: Umate became the second person in charge under the Director of Imperial Funeral Pyre for Emperor Jito.

sen.j: 位は正五位下。
sen.e: Umate was ranked as Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
Umate was ranked as Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 慶雲4年（707年）6月15日 - 文武天皇のための造山陵使になった。
sen.e: June 15th, 707: Umate became the Imperial envoy of Emperor Tenmu for Tsukuriyama no Misasagi.
June 15th, 707: Umate became the Imperial envoy of Emperor Tenmu for Tsukuriyama no Misasagi.

sen.j: 位は正五位上。
sen.e: Umate was ranked as Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
Umate was ranked as Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 和銅2年（709年）1月9日 - 正五位上から従四位下に進んだ。
sen.e: On January 9th, 709: Umate was promoted to Jushinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) from Shogoinojo.
On January 9th, 709: Umate was promoted to Jushinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) from Shogoinojo.

sen.j: 和銅4年（711年）2月26日 - 従四位下で死んだ。
sen.e: February 26th, 711: Umate died ranked as Jushinoge.
